TestCase.TestCase_Title: Create variables in both administrator and user owned categories

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a "Category0" category within the "AdminContext" context
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Create a "Category1" category within the "Participation to AdminContext" context and save it
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Category0" category
Right click in the variable viewer and select "New" -> "Variable"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable0" variable has been added to the "Category0" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "Category0" category in the context viewer and select "New" -> "FileVariable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FileVariable0" variable has been added to the "Category0" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click in the variable viewer and select "New" -> "FolderVariable"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FolderVariable0" variable has been added to the "Category0" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Category1" category in the context viewer and select "New" -> "Variable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable0" variable has been added to the "Category1" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click in the variable viewer and select "New" -> "FileVariable"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FileVariable0" variable has been added to the "Category1" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "Category1" category in the context viewer and select "New" -> "FolderVariable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FolderVariable0" variable has been added to the "Category1" category in the variable viewer

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Create variables in administrator category in user context

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a "Category0" category within the "AdminContext" context
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Category0" category and select "New" -> "Variable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable0" variable has been addedto the "Category0" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "FileVariable"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FileVariable0" variable has been added to the "Category0" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "FolderVariable"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FolderVariable0" variable has been added to the "Category0" category in the variable viewer

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Create variables in the Orchestra category

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "Variable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Orchestra" category in the context viewer
Right click in the variable viewer and select "New" -> "Variable"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable1" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Cannot create variables in the Orchestra installation category

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Orchestra installation" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "New" -> "Variable" entry of the contextual menu is not available

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "Variable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Fill "Unique value:" textfield with value "Value0"
Fill the "Comment" textfield with "This is a mono-valued variable"
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable value is now "Value0"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "FileVariable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FileVariable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "FileVariable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Browse" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select file "C:\Windows\win.ini"
Click on the "Open" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The file selector disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Fill the "Comment" textfield with "This is a mono-valued file variable"
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FileVariable0" variable value is now "C:\Windows\win.ini"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "FolderVariable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FolderVariable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "FolderVariable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Browse" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select directory "C:\Windows"
Click on the "Open" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The file selector disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Fill the "Comment" textfield with "This is a mono-valued folder variable"
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FolderVariable0" variable value is now "C:\Windows"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "Variable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Multiple values" radio button
Click on the first row of the mulitple values table and enter the value "Value0"
Click on the "Add" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A new row has been added to the multiple values table

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the second row of the mulitple values table and enter the value "Value1"
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable has two values: "Value0" and "Value1"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "FileVariable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FileVariable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "FileVariable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Multiple values" radio button
Click on the "Browse" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select file "C:\Windows\win.ini"
Click on the "Open" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The file selector disappears. The first value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\win.ini"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Add" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A new row has been added to the multiple values table

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the second row of the mulitple values table
Click on the "Browse" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select file "C:\Windows\system.ini"
Click on the "Open" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The file selector disappears. The second value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\system.ini"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FileVariable0" variable has two values: "C:\Windows\win.ini" and "C:\Windows\system.ini"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "FolderVariable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FolderVariable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "FolderVariable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Multiple values" radio button
Click on the "Browse" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select folder "C:\Windows"
Click on the "Open" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The file selector disappears. The first value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Add" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A new row has been added to the multiple values table

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the second row of the mulitple values table
Click on the "Browse" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select directory "C:\Windows\System32"
Click on the "Open" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The file selector disappears. The second value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\System32"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FolderVariable0" variable has two values: "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\System32"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Create a variable referencing a mono-valued variable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a mono-valued variable "Variable0" of type "Variable" within the "Orchestra" category, with value "Value0"
Create a mono-valued variable "FileVariable0" of type "FileVariable" within the "Orchestra" category, with value "C:\Window\win.ini"
Create a mono-valued variable "FolderVariable0" of type "FolderVariable" within the "Orchestra" category, with value "C:\Windows"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "Variable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable1" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable1" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield is empty.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Variables…" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Variable browser" dialog box pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Unfold the "AdminContext" context
Unfold the "Orchestra" category
Select the "Variable0" variable
Click on the "OK" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable browser" dialog box disappears. In the "Edit variable" dialog box, the "Unique value" textfield has been filled with value "${odm:\Orchestra\Variable0}"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "Variable1" variable value is now "Value0"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "FileVariable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FileVariable1" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "FileVariable1" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield is empty.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Variables…" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Variable browser" dialog box pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Unfold the "AdminContext" context
Unfold the "Orchestra" category
Select the "FileVariable0" variable
Click on the "OK" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable browser" dialog box disappears. In the "Edit variable" dialog box, the "Unique value" textfield has been filled with value "${odm:\Orchestra\FileVariable0}"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FileVariable1" variable value is now "C:\Window\win.ini"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "FolderVariable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FolderVariable1" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "FolderVariable1" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield is empty.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Variables…" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Variable browser" dialog box pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Unfold the "AdminContext" context
Unfold the "Orchestra" category
Select the "FolderVariable0" variable
Click on the "OK" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable browser" dialog box disappears. In the "Edit variable" dialog box, the "Unique value" textfield has been filled with value "${odm:\Orchestra\FolderVariable0}"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FolderVariable1" variable value is now "C:\Windows"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Create a variable referencing an environment variable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "Variable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield is empty.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Fill the "Unique value" textfield with value "${env_var:PATH}
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. In the variable viewer, the value of the "Variable0" variable contains the value of the "PATH" environment variable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
In the "Orchestra" category of the "AdminContext" context, set "ArtefactPath" and "ConfigurationDirectories" variables
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "Variable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value" textfield is empty.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "mandatory" check box at the bottom
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
In the context viewer, right click on the "AdminContext" and select "Validate"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An error window pops up, with a message "Problems encountered during validation"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Details>>" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the error list, the error message "Variable 'AdminContext\Orchestra\Variable0' is mandatory : it must contain non empty values"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the 'AdminContext' context and select 'Set as current context' in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An error window pops up, with a message "Problems encountered during validation"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Details>>" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the error list, the error message "Variable 'AdminContext\Orchestra\Variable0' is mandatory : it must contain non empty values"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: The value of a file variable shall only be a path to a file

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
In the "Orchestra" category of the "AdminContext" context, set "ArtefactPath" and "ConfigurationDirectories" variables
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "FileVariable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FileVariable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "FileVariable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value" textfield is empty.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Fill the "Unique value" textfield with "Value0"
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FileVariable0" variable value is now "Value0"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the context viewer, right click on the "AdminContext" and select "Validate"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An warning window pops up, with a message "Problems encountered during validation"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Details>>" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the warning list, the error message "Variable 'AdminContext\Orchestra\FileVariable0' : value 'Value0' is not a valid file (raw value is 'Value0')"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: The value of a folder variable shall only be a path to a folder

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "FolderVariable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "FolderVariable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "FolderVariable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value" textfield is empty.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Fill the "Unique value" textfield with "Value0"
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FolderVariable0" variable value is now "Value0"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the context viewer, right click on the "AdminContext" and select "Validate"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An warning window pops up, with a message "Problems encountered during validation"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Details>>" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the warning list, the error message "Variable 'AdminContext\Orchestra\FolderVariable0' : value 'Value0' is not a valid folder (raw value is 'Value0')"
